column4: Is it possible to use a debian net-install cd to install ubuntu?
mixing Debian and Ubuntu repositories will cause breakage.
Well, if you don't add any debian repositories during install and run it from the ubuntu repositories, it should work, right?
the base system is different too.
I see... Well, as a few people have reporting to succesfully upgrading from sid or even sarge to ubuntu, I guess I could upgrade using a very minimal base install?
It seems to be my only possibility to get ubuntu right now...
I don't have an internet connection that can bear the download of the cd, and the only linux I could buy around here was fedora core 2...
the shipIt cd's haven't arrived either
shipit.ubuntu.com. It's how I got my Ubuntu. :-)
I know, I already ordered from there
big rewards for those who wait. ;-)
actually, if you're willing to download a bit over a day, you can download just the single install iso over the net. I did that for Hoary.
